content.description: Previously an aid line (I'd guess A2, but I'm not an aid climber - the aid grade isn't listed in the guidebook). The route follows the thin seam that takes tiny gear. There is a small tree at the top that the guidebook suggests not lowering/TRing off of. Walk off left / downclimb a tree.
content.protection: The small stuff. The guidebook notes that an "occasional microcam will fit in the flare up high."

content.description: Wide crack (reach high for a good fist jam) with a white streak on the bottom. Thins out and disappears 2/3 of the way up the boulder. The face move above the crack is protected by a single bolt then run out easy climbing to the top.
content.location: South face of the loop boulder furthest from the trail. Its a gaping crack, you can't miss it.

content.description: Enchanted Rock-style sport route (ie. both bold and slab) that is covered in lichen. The crystals on the top may be brittle.
content.location: 20 ft. left of Practicing Cannibals, on the north side of the Loop Boulder closest to the trail.

content.description: The Loop Boulders are two (large) boulders off the loop trail. The guidebook lists them with Little Dome, but thats a bit deceiving, in my opinion. The best approach is via the Loop Trail from the west end of the parking lot, these two boulders are West of Little Dome proper, on the right side of the trail.
